concise_definition: n. 化妆, 化妆品; 组成, 补偿; v. 化妆, 弥补

definitions.explanation_en: Cosmetics used to enhance or alter the appearance of the face, especially to conceal imperfections or emphasize features.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于修饰或改变面部外观的化妆品，常用于掩盖瑕疵或突出五官特征。
definitions.example_en: She applied a light layer of makeup before the interview.
definitions.example_cn: 她在面试前轻轻涂了一层妆。

definitions.explanation_en: The composition or arrangement of parts that form a whole, often referring to the structure or content of a group, system, or team.
definitions.explanation_cn: 构成整体的各个部分的组成或安排，常用于描述群体、系统或团队的构成。
definitions.example_en: The makeup of the committee includes experts from five different countries.
definitions.example_cn: 该委员会的成员由来自五个不同国家的专家组成。

definitions.explanation_en: Something given or done to compensate for a loss, deficiency, or missed opportunity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 为弥补损失、不足或错失机会而给予或采取的补偿措施。
definitions.example_en: The school offered a makeup exam for students who were sick on the test day.
definitions.example_cn: 学校为考试当天生病的学生安排了补考。

definitions.explanation_en: To apply cosmetics to one's face to improve or change appearance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在脸上涂抹化妆品以改善或改变外貌。
definitions.example_en: She made up her face before going to the party.

definitions.explanation_en: To compensate for something lost, missed, or inadequate by doing or providing something extra.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过额外做某事或提供某些东西来弥补失去的、错过的或不足的部分。
definitions.example_en: He stayed up late to make up for the hours he missed at work.
definitions.example_cn: 他熬夜工作，以弥补之前错过的工时。

comparison.analysis: “Cosmetics”（化妆品）是“makeup”的上位词，泛指所有用于美容的化学产品，包括护肤品、香水、指甲油等；而 “makeup” 专指用于面部修饰的彩妆产品，如粉底、眼影、口红等，范围更窄、更具体。
“Composition”（构成）是一个更正式、更广泛的术语，用于描述任何系统、结构或文本的组成部分，适用于科学、艺术、写作等领域；而 “makeup” 在表示“组成”时更口语化，常用于描述人群、团队或组织的构成，语气更轻松。
“Compensation”（补偿）是法律或经济语境中更正式的术语，通常指金钱或物质上的赔偿；而 “makeup” 在表示“弥补”时更常用于日常语境，如补课、补考、补时间等，强调行为上的补救而非经济回报。
